section.title: AFTER-SECTIONS
section.para: Same as SECTION, except it is only run a single time per window, and only after all normal SECTIONs have run.

section.title: AND
section.para: Deprecated: use "LINK 0" instead. An inline keyword put between contextual tests as shorthand for "LINK 0".

section.title: BEFORE-SECTIONS
section.para: Same as SECTION, except it is only run a single time per window, and only before all normal SECTIONs have run.

section.title: CONSTRAINTS
section.para: Deprecated: use SECTION instead. A section of the grammar that can contain SELECT, REMOVE, and IFF entries.

section.title: CORRECTIONS
section.para: Deprecated: use BEFORE-SECTIONS instead. A section of the grammar that can contain APPEND and SUBSTITUTE entries.

section.title: DELIMIT
section.para:
If it finds a reading which satisfies the target and the contextual tests, DELIMIT will cut the disambituation window immediately after the cohort the reading is in. After delimiting in this manner, CG-3 will bail out and disambiguate the newly formed window from the start.
This should not be used instead of DELIMITERS unless you know what you are doing.

section.title: DELIMITERS
section.para: Sets a list of hard delimiters. If one of these are found the disambuation window is cut immediately after the cohort it was found in. If no delimiters are defined or the window exceeds the hard limit (defaults to 500 cohorts), the window will be cut arbitarily. Internally, this is converted to the magic set _S_DELIMITERS_.

section.title: IF
section.para: Deprecated: has no effect in CG-3. An inline keyword put before the first contextual test of a rule.

section.title: IFF
section.para: Singles out a reading from the cohort that matches the target, and if all contextual tests are satisfied it will behave as a SELECT rule. If the tests are not satisfied it will behave as a REMOVE rule.

section.title: LIST
section.para: Defines a new set based on a list of tags.
section.screen: LIST setname = tag othertag (mtag htag) ltag ;

section.title: MAPPINGS
section.para: Deprecated: use BEFORE-SECTIONS instead. A section of the grammar that can contain MAP, ADD, and REPLACE entries.

section.title: REMOVE
section.para: Singles out a reading from the cohort that matches the target, and if all contextual tests are satisfied it will delete the mached reading.

section.title: SECTION
section.para: A section of the grammar that can contain all types of rule and set definition entries.

section.title: SELECT
section.para: Singles out a reading from the cohort that matches the target, and if all contextual tests are satisfied it will delete all other readings except the matched one.

section.title: SET
section.para: Defines a new set based on operations between existing sets.

section.title: SETS
section.para: Deprecated: has no effect in CG-3. A section of the grammar that can contain SET and LIST entries.

section.title: SOFT-DELIMITERS
section.para: Sets a list of soft delimiters. If a disambiguation window is approaching the soft-limit (defaults to 300 cohorts), CG-3 will begin to look for a soft delimiter to cut the window after. Internally, this is converted to the magic set _S_SOFT_DELIMITERS_.

section.title: TARGET
section.para: Deprecated: has no effect in CG-3. An inline keyword put before the target of a rule.
